javadoc: ScrollingListChoicesPanel provides a table type of format for resolving Each row that has choices represents the choices for a single conflict. Each conflict choice has a corresponding radio button and scrolling table/list of text.

methods.javadoc:
This sets the text that appears as the border title of this panel.
@param conflictType the type of conflict being resolved.
methods.name: setTitle
methods.comment: This sets the text that appears as the border title of this panel.

params.name: conflictType
params.comment: the type of conflict being resolved.

methods.javadoc:
This sets the header text that appears above the table.
@param text the text
methods.name: setHeader
methods.comment: This sets the header text that appears above the table.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table.
methods.name: allChoicesAreResolved
methods.comment: Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table and
 made the same choice for every row.
methods.name: allChoicesAreSame
methods.comment:
Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table and
 made the same choice for every row.

methods.javadoc: Removes header text for this panel and all table/row information.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Removes header text for this panel and all table/row information.

name: ScrollingListChoicesPanel
comment:
ScrollingListChoicesPanel provides a table type of format for resolving
 Each row that has choices represents the choices for a single conflict. Each conflict
 choice has a corresponding radio button and scrolling table/list of text.
